name: places/ChIJVVVlvR32wokRPLsVm4eQmPA
formattedAddress: 1490 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1490 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029-4502, USA

editorialSummary.text: Department of the Walgreens chain providing prescription medications & other health-related items.

originalText.text: Scheduled Covid/Flu vaccines well in advance, filled out paperwork, arranged my schedule to be open for day following vaccination, received email confirmation day before, showed up 15-minutes early as directed -- Pharmacy Closed ! Outrageous that a pharmacy, especially right next to a major city hospital, can be so unreliable. Avoid!

text.text: Scheduled Covid/Flu vaccines well in advance, filled out paperwork, arranged my schedule to be open for day following vaccination, received email confirmation day before, showed up 15-minutes early as directed -- Pharmacy Closed ! Outrageous that a pharmacy, especially right next to a major city hospital, can be so unreliable. Avoid!

originalText.text: Although they advertise my insurance accepted, "they dont!"

text.text: Although they advertise my insurance accepted, "they dont!"

originalText.text:
I went to the Walgreens Pharmacy location (Store #14369) at 1490 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029 on Sunday Oct 31, 2021 around 11:00 AM to pick up two prescriptions.

Only one prescription was available. I paid for it, and then I asked about the other one.

The UNMASKED woman, with boredom in her eyes, mumbled:

"prescriptionfilledoutelsewheresincenoinsuranceidunnowhereitis."

Yes, this is difficult to read. Imagine trying to hear her speaking MASKLESS, so I don't know why she has a natural-born muffler in her throat.

With her eyes looking more lifeless than a cheap GCI-generated character, I knew she was not going to help anyone, especially since she was not wearing a FACE MASK.

I don't know her name, but if you check your timestamped security cameras, it's probably the listless woman WITHOUT A MASK. Since it was Halloween, she probably decided to role-play as a “NO MASK Lackadaisical Person Working in a Walgreens Pharmacy During a Pandemic and Not Caring.”

I walked to another Walgreens Pharmacy. The other location was able to help me, even with a long line of people. I was able to get the prescription on the spot at the second - BUSIER - location.

This prescription was important as it was for post-surgery care for a family member.

Let me ask you: How does one busy location be able to assist, while the other location – which was more lifeless than a cemetery – fumbles, mumbles, and bumbles through it?

I will try to put up a review. One gets a great one, the other one does not.

Guess which one 1490 Madison Ave (Store #14369) is going to get?

originalText.text: The pharmacy is always on point! Always.

text.text: The pharmacy is always on point! Always.
